text: One of my favorite games of the past years, I consider it a masterpiece. I'm glad it's getting a Switch release as it needs as much visibility as it can get, and I'll surely buy the physical version if there's ever one. The soundtrack is top notch as well, and exploring the bamboo forest of the Sapphire Ridge at night with this theme playing simply felt perfect.
author: SupraDarky

text:
very interesting picture there...
Reminds me of Kid from CC looking into the distance...
author: The Destati

text: You've never let me down when it comes to games I haven't hurt of, so it's going onto my wishlist ^_^
author: garfreeek

text: Well said mate. This game is unique and extremely rewarding. Can't barely find a flaw.
author: NimRook

text: I agree, this game is a zelda-like game that's extremely under the radar imo. The music is phenominal and the characters are fun. I should really get back to playing this game
author: MysticFate

text: This OST is SO good, great pick! I've been wondering, and this isn't an accusation or anything, but it seems like the composer REALLY liked Chrono Cross. Compare the track in the Bergen Hills vs. Predicament from CC, and the track in the lightning dungeon vs. Chonopolis from CC, for example. You can really hear the influence/homage there!
author: Sam Smith

text: I love this game, very glad to see it added to your list!
author: Tequehead

text: A lot of the tracks from this game remind me of Xenosaga 2 and 3.  This is not one of them, but I wanted to say it anyway.  can't wait until the physical versions of this game go up on amazon so I can get those as well for both ps4 and Switch.  I already have the digital version, but I like having spares.
author: Saint Boot

text: this sounds like the SPECTRASONICS KEYGEN.EXE

text: If you're interested in saving the planet and animals from abuse and certain death, going vegan will help. Watch Cowspiracy, What the Health, and Dominion (2018) for more information.

text: I don't play the game, but this is ost is beatifoul

text: Fucking love this game, absolutely in my top 5

text: This game tragically overlooked. Probably my second favorite game of this generation (After BOTW)

text: Early in the morning. Don't ever go supradarky !!

text: Wow this game looks and sounds beautiful
author: Barret Wallace

text: This game is great but dungeons are so time consuming I gotta stop in the middle of them
author: HeavensMeat

text: The dungeons are definitely very meaty.
author: SupraDarky

text:
Yet surprisingly, i enjoyed them! 
I'm the kind of person who normally doesn't even like dungeons in games. Even ones on the shorter end of the spectrum like in Zelda games. Yet CrossCode's dungeons were so good, i didn't dread going into them at all.  Good job, CrossCode.
author: Kachunnga

text: Crosscode is my favorite game ever!

text: Thanks for introducing me to this game!

text: i played a demo of this game and loved it and ever since i've always wanted to get it on steam

text: I reckon Crosscode will be huge like Hollow Knight when it comes out on the Switch next year, it's a great game!
author: Wispe

text: I hope so too because it's such an amazing game but I won't hold my breath. If big popular people don't notice it, it will probably fly under the radar for many

text: Unfortunately this comment aged poorly. Nintendo didn't even try to promote it, its really sad

text: @Death Mountain its unfortunate but hopefully it still sells well

text: This song is too relaxing
author: Adrilander

text: This game has been sitting in my steam library for a while. Im waiting for the right time to dive in, because I wanna explore everything the game has to offer. Being such a big game, I dont wanna start it unmotivated and just flake off halfway through.
author: Spencer

text:
They recently made NG+ and if I understood correctly they have special dialogue and cheats you can use in NG+.
The game still is supposed to be getting a post game episode which they are still working on but they have added a boss/challenge arena too.
author: NaCl

text: @Spencer it isn't super duper time consuming... Unless ya go for 100%. Don't do that.
author: Jimmy John Joe Jr.

text: Its pretty time consuming if you want good  up to date gear every zone, farming/questing/finding 5 new pieces of gear to stay up to date in every new area put me at 40 hours, even on my 3rd run through where i can do it pretty quick
author: mrjeb

text: So nice to see CrossCode getting featured on this channel! One of the rare games I bought on Early Access, and I didn't regret it. An obvious amount of polish went into it, and it shows. :)

text: I'm really hoping the PS4 port (announced April 2018 along with XONE and Switch) gets a release before the end of the year!

text: Switch port is planned to be coming out next year according to the dev livestream the other day
